intro: Oldenlandia goreensis var. erecta, commonly known as the erect oldenlandia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered with fine hairs. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
